snippet: Despite appeals from the Ukrainian armed forces, the United States has provided only a modest package of nonlethal assistance to the government in Kiev, and much of it has yet to arrive.
abstract: Military Memo; United States is reluctant to step up military assistance to Ukraine for fear that it will lead to an escalation in fighting and provoke Moscow; its $70 million in aid includes rations, radios, first-aid kits and limited supplies of body amour, but no arms, and much of it has yet to arrive.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Despite appeals from the Ukrainian armed forces, the United States has provided only a modest package of nonlethal assistance to the government in Kiev, and much of it has yet to arrive.

headline.main: Amid Intensifying Requests, American Military Aid to Ukraine Stalls
headline.print_headline: Amid Intensifying Requests, American Military Aid to Ukraine Stalls
